RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 18600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHASE LIL ME broke inward and rounded the first turn off the rail, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, circled horses five wide on the far turn and dug in through the stretch to get up the final yards. SCARE DEM was pinched back at the break then saved ground well back, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths, left the turn outside and dug in to take second under the wire. ALDRINALINE settled off the rail, gave chase past the half mile pole, raced four wide on the far turn and dug in through the stretch, but was nipped from second under the wire. JAZZ WITH DENIS raced with the pace, dueled to even terms leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the nod at the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn near the rail and was met flattening stride later yards. BURR HILL BULLET raced with the early pace inside but steadied at the rail on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. MODERN DAY ROMANCE raced off the rail the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. ORANGEBURG stalked from the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn but weakened nearing mid-stretch. S S MIRAGE raced in the four path the first turn then took the lead three wide at the nine sixteenths pole, dueled at mostly even terms through the backstretch but dropped back toward the quarter pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Aldrinaline
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased past 1/2,4wd far turn,nipped 2nd wire

ENTRY.NAME: Scare Dem
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched back start,saved ground,chased 7/16,4p turn,up 2nd wire

ENTRY.NAME: Chase Lil Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,bid 7/16,circled 5wd turn,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Jazz With Denis
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,dueled 7/16,rail far turn,met flattening late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 16 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CIDERHOUSE WAY gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, dug in leaving the turn and got up the final yards. GEORGE angled to the inside and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled through the lane, but was caught flattening stride the final yards. NOCASHREFUNDS was pinched back on the chute then chased outside, rounded the turn in the five path and came along to take third the final strides. KARMA BUS chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. ELEANORS JACK chased and raced in range of the lead off the rail, but weakened inside the eighth pole. MISSIONARY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. BERTRAM FLIGHT and REMYS GUNSMOKE were not factors.

ENTRY.NAME: Karma Bus
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Nocashrefunds
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched back chute,chased outside,5p turn,along 3rd final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Ciderhouse Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,4p turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: George
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught flattening final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AKEMI closed to the lead approaching the five sixteenths pole, widened at the rail on the turn and held well under a vigorous hand ride. LITTLE BIT OF THAT was shuffled back at the start but gave close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and dug in to hold second. COACH RUBE chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LUNATIC was shuffled back at the start, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. MY LOVELY GIRL was pinched back at the start then gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path, raced outside into the lane and passed some rivals. GHOSTLY SQUALL veered in at the break, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. ORGANIZED CHAOS was not a factor and rounded the turn about the six path. TIZ THE REASON ducked out at the break, took a brief early lead then gave chase but faded at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz the Reason
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,briefly led,chased,faded rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Little Bit of That
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Akemi
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 5/16,widened rail turn,vigorous hand ride lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 14200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 16, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Since June 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, i f for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROAD SLEW stalked off the rail then took over past the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, dueled clear midway on the far turn and held well under steady handling. HAPPY CHARLIE raced in the four path the first turn and settled off the pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path then dueled through the stretch and took the nod for second under the wire. CURLIN'S THRILL saved early ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the six path, dueled through the stretch but missed the nod for second. MAGNETRON rated close inside, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, dug in through the stretch but was nipped from second and third under the wire. MIRACLE SILVER raced in the five path the first turn, came through the second turn in the seven path and gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. PARTY MONSTER set the early pace inside, was met past the three quarter pole then challenged approaching the three eighths, but dropped back midway on the far turn and weakened in the lane. HOT N SPICY LOVE rounded the opening turn in the five path then stalked the pace, picked up the chase from the three eighths but weakened in the four path on the far turn. SKILLFUL settled inside early and saved ground. INDIAN BUZZ was shuffled back early and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin's Thrill
ENTRY.OWNER: Deckert Jr Robert and Brown Keith A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 98. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since November 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OVERLY CRITICAL stalked off the rail, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and dug in under steady encouragement to get up the final yards. O'CONNER SUNSET raced with the pace two deep, dueled from the seven sixteenths pole and cleared TAP SECRET at the quarter pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was steadily handled through the lane, but gave up the lead in the final yards. The latter raced with the pace inside and dueled from the seven sixteenths pole, but dropped back at the rail into the far turn and weakened in the lane. ALPHA CHI RHO stalked from the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. UNANIMOUS CONSENT (GB) raced well back and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Overly Critical
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 7/16,off rail turn,up final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MINISTRY OF MAGIC stumbled leaving the gate and raced in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and steadily progressed, rounded the far turn about the four path, dug in leaving the turn and inched ahead nearing the wire. REMYS SHOWTIME angled in and stalked from the five eighths pole, took the lead approaching the half pole and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths, raced clear toward the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane, but was caught inside the sixteenth pole and grudgingly ceded. SPUNMAN saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and raced in the four path on the far turn, dug in to take third later yards and was gaining on the runner-up. GREAT DAYS AHEAD took the lead at the rail into the first turn but was met approaching the half mile pole, gave chase through the backstretch but dropped back leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. YO VINNIE stalked from the three path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened. ROCKIN THE PALACE raced well off the pace and off the rail the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn wide and could only close the gap in the lane. SARGENT KOBE saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Spunman
ENTRY.OWNER: Boyer James A and Coleswood Farm Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,4p far turn,up 3rd late,gaining on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Rockin the Palace
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,eased out 1/2,chased 3/8,wide turn,closed gap

ENTRY.NAME: Ministry of Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,4p 1st turn,chased 7/16,4p far turn,up late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AIM FOR THE CORK tapered in and rated a slim lead through the backstretch, came under pressure at the quarter pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn and dug in determinedly through the lane. RIDE THE BRAND came away with a brief early lead then gave chase, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch but held on for second. TIME TO ROCK broke awkwardly then steadied, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the seven path and was closing well, but was taken in hand late. WHALE OF A RUN chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. BRADLEY DO RIGHT gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. GREATEST NOTION chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn two deep then flattened in the lane. ESTRELLA FUGAZ gave chase then flattened in the five path on the turn. TIME TO SNOOZE and BOUNDTONOONE were not factors.

ENTRY.NAME: Time to Rock
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,steadied,chased,7p turn,closing well,in hand late

ENTRY.NAME: Ride the Brand
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief lead,pressed pace,close 2d turn,dug in lane,held 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIGHTNIN RUNNER took the lead at the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn at the rail and was steadily handled in the lane. DULCIMER DAME settled close in the five path on the opening turn, picked up the chase nearing the three quarter pole, raced in the four path on the far turn then dueled through the final sixteenth for second. AZZURRA hesitated at the break and raced well back from early contention, left the first turn outside and gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and finished well for third while gaining on the runner-up. MOONLIT SHADOW stalked off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn then flattened in the lane. FULL MOON LOVER rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. UNCAPTURED RUBY saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Full Moon Lover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Moonlit Shadow
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 7/16,2d far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 14200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 16, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since June 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUPER QUALITY took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was kept alert to draw off. ROYAL THUNDER settled off the rail the opening turn, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in to take second the final strides. NEVER COMPROMISE raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase past the half mile pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, flattened in the lane and gave up second the final strides. INDIANA RED raced well off the early pace about the three path, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and showed little in the stretch. PROTA rated close off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and flattened in the lane. AT THE BEACH raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and showed little in the stretch. ROCKY DICE was checked from tight quarters early then saved ground. BLUE N GOLD rated close inside the first turn, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but faded at the rail nearing the far turn. PEPE AND HEYWOOD was shuffled back early then drifted into the first turn, gave chase past the half mile pole but weakened into the far turn. SEVEN AND SEVEN was carried out into the first turn, left the turn outside and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Thunder
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,rail far turn,up 2nd final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Blue N Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Funkhouser III, Raymond J. and Funkhouser, John C.
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,faded rail near turn

ENTRY.NAME: Prota
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Super Quality
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/4,rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,rail turn,kept alert

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Terrazas Thoroughbreds, LLC, JasonLitt, SB Racing Corp. &
